21  package org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client;
22  
23  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HConstants;
24  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.filter.Filter;
25  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.filter.IncompatibleFilterException;
26  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.TimeRange;
27  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.Bytes;
28  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.Classes;
29  import org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable;
30  
31  import java.io.DataInput;
32  import java.io.DataOutput;
33  import java.io.IOException;
34  import java.util.ArrayList;
35  import java.util.HashMap;
36  import java.util.List;
37  import java.util.Map;
38  import java.util.NavigableSet;
39  import java.util.TreeMap;
40  import java.util.TreeSet;
41  
42  /**
43   * Used to perform Scan operations.
44   * <p>
45   * All operations are identical to {@link Get} with the exception of
46   * instantiation.  Rather than specifying a single row, an optional startRow
47   * and stopRow may be defined.  If rows are not specified, the Scanner will
48   * iterate over all rows.
49   * <p>
50   * To scan everything for each row, instantiate a Scan object.
51   * <p>
52   * To modify scanner caching for just this scan, use {@link #setCaching(int) setCaching}.
53   * If caching is NOT set, we will use the caching value of the hosting
54   * {@link HTable}.  See {@link HTable#setScannerCaching(int)}.
55   * <p>
56   * To further define the scope of what to get when scanning, perform additional
57   * methods as outlined below.
58   * <p>
59   * To get all columns from specific families, execute {@link #addFamily(byte[]) addFamily}
60   * for each family to retrieve.
61   * <p>
62   * To get specific columns, execute {@link #addColumn(byte[], byte[]) addColumn}
63   * for each column to retrieve.
64   * <p>
65   * To only retrieve columns within a specific range of version timestamps,
66   * execute {@link #setTimeRange(long, long) setTimeRange}.
67   * <p>
68   * To only retrieve columns with a specific timestamp, execute
69   * {@link #setTimeStamp(long) setTimestamp}.
70   * <p>
71   * To limit the number of versions of each column to be returned, execute
72   * {@link #setMaxVersions(int) setMaxVersions}.
73   * <p>
74   * To limit the maximum number of values returned for each call to next(),
75   * execute {@link #setBatch(int) setBatch}.
76   * <p>
77   * To add a filter, execute {@link #setFilter(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.filter.Filter) setFilter}.
78   * <p>
79   * Expert: To explicitly disable server-side block caching for this scan,
80   * execute {@link #setCacheBlocks(boolean)}.
81   */
82  public class Scan extends OperationWithAttributes implements Writable {
83    private static final String RAW_ATTR = "_raw_";
84    private static final String ONDEMAND_ATTR = "_ondemand_";
85    private static final String ISOLATION_LEVEL = "_isolationlevel_";
86  
87    private static final byte SCAN_VERSION = (byte)2;
88    private byte [] startRow = HConstants.EMPTY_START_ROW;
89    private byte [] stopRow  = HConstants.EMPTY_END_ROW;
90    private int maxVersions = 1;
91    private int batch = -1;
92    // If application wants to collect scan metrics, it needs to
93    // call scan.setAttribute(SCAN_ATTRIBUTES_ENABLE, Bytes.toBytes(Boolean.TRUE))
94    static public String SCAN_ATTRIBUTES_METRICS_ENABLE = "scan.attributes.metrics.enable";
95    static public String SCAN_ATTRIBUTES_METRICS_DATA = "scan.attributes.metrics.data";
96    
97    // If an application wants to use multiple scans over different tables each scan must
98    // define this attribute with the appropriate table name by calling
99    // scan.setAttribute(Scan.SCAN_ATTRIBUTES_TABLE_NAME, Bytes.toBytes(tableName))
100   static public final String SCAN_ATTRIBUTES_TABLE_NAME = "scan.attributes.table.name";
101 
102   /*
103    * -1 means no caching
104    */
105   private int caching = -1;
106   private boolean cacheBlocks = true;
107   private Filter filter = null;
108   private TimeRange tr = new TimeRange();
109   private Map<byte [], NavigableSet<byte []>> familyMap =
110     new TreeMap<byte [], NavigableSet<byte []>>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
111 
112   /**
113    * Create a Scan operation across all rows.
114    */
115   public Scan() {}
116 
117   public Scan(byte [] startRow, Filter filter) {
118     this(startRow);
119     this.filter = filter;
120   }
121 
122   /**
123    * Create a Scan operation starting at the specified row.
124    * <p>
125    * If the specified row does not exist, the Scanner will start from the
126    * next closest row after the specified row.
127    * @param startRow row to start scanner at or after
128    */
129   public Scan(byte [] startRow) {
130     this.startRow = startRow;
131   }
132 
133   /**
134    * Create a Scan operation for the range of rows specified.
135    * @param startRow row to start scanner at or after (inclusive)
136    * @param stopRow row to stop scanner before (exclusive)
137    */
138   public Scan(byte [] startRow, byte [] stopRow) {
139     this.startRow = startRow;
140     this.stopRow = stopRow;
141   }
142 
143   /**
144    * Creates a new instance of this class while copying all values.
145    *
146    * @param scan  The scan instance to copy from.
147    * @throws IOException When copying the values fails.
148    */
149   public Scan(Scan scan) throws IOException {
150     startRow = scan.getStartRow();
151     stopRow  = scan.getStopRow();
152     maxVersions = scan.getMaxVersions();
153     batch = scan.getBatch();
154     caching = scan.getCaching();
155     cacheBlocks = scan.getCacheBlocks();
156     filter = scan.getFilter(); // clone?
157     TimeRange ctr = scan.getTimeRange();
158     tr = new TimeRange(ctr.getMin(), ctr.getMax());
159     Map<byte[], NavigableSet<byte[]>> fams = scan.getFamilyMap();
160     for (Map.Entry<byte[],NavigableSet<byte[]>> entry : fams.entrySet()) {
161       byte [] fam = entry.getKey();
162       NavigableSet<byte[]> cols = entry.getValue();
163       if (cols != null && cols.size() > 0) {
164         for (byte[] col : cols) {
165           addColumn(fam, col);
166         }
167       } else {
168         addFamily(fam);
169       }
170     }
171     for (Map.Entry<String, byte[]> attr : scan.getAttributesMap().entrySet()) {
172       setAttribute(attr.getKey(), attr.getValue());
173     }
174   }
175 
176   /**
177    * Builds a scan object with the same specs as get.
178    * @param get get to model scan after
179    */
180   public Scan(Get get) {
181     this.startRow = get.getRow();
182     this.stopRow = get.getRow();
183     this.filter = get.getFilter();
184     this.cacheBlocks = get.getCacheBlocks();
185     this.maxVersions = get.getMaxVersions();
186     this.tr = get.getTimeRange();
187     this.familyMap = get.getFamilyMap();
188   }
189 
190   public boolean isGetScan() {
191     return this.startRow != null && this.startRow.length > 0 &&
192       Bytes.equals(this.startRow, this.stopRow);
193   }
194 
195   /**
196    * Get all columns from the specified family.
197    * <p>
198    * Overrides previous calls to addColumn for this family.
199    * @param family family name
200    * @return this
201    */
202   public Scan addFamily(byte [] family) {
203     familyMap.remove(family);
204     familyMap.put(family, null);
205     return this;
206   }
207 
208   /**
209    * Get the column from the specified family with the specified qualifier.
210    * <p>
211    * Overrides previous calls to addFamily for this family.
212    * @param family family name
213    * @param qualifier column qualifier
214    * @return this
215    */
216   public Scan addColumn(byte [] family, byte [] qualifier) {
217     NavigableSet<byte []> set = familyMap.get(family);
218     if(set == null) {
219       set = new TreeSet<byte []>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
220     }
221     if (qualifier == null) {
222       qualifier = HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY;
223     }
224     set.add(qualifier);
225     familyMap.put(family, set);
226     return this;
227   }
228 
229   /**
230    * Get versions of columns only within the specified timestamp range,
231    * [minStamp, maxStamp).  Note, default maximum versions to return is 1.  If
232    * your time range spans more than one version and you want all versions
233    * returned, up the number of versions beyond the defaut.
234    * @param minStamp minimum timestamp value, inclusive
235    * @param maxStamp maximum timestamp value, exclusive
236    * @throws IOException if invalid time range
237    * @see #setMaxVersions()
238    * @see #setMaxVersions(int)
239    * @return this
240    */
241   public Scan setTimeRange(long minStamp, long maxStamp)
242   throws IOException {
243     tr = new TimeRange(minStamp, maxStamp);
244     return this;
245   }
246 
247   /**
248    * Get versions of columns with the specified timestamp. Note, default maximum
249    * versions to return is 1.  If your time range spans more than one version
250    * and you want all versions returned, up the number of versions beyond the
251    * defaut.
252    * @param timestamp version timestamp
253    * @see #setMaxVersions()
254    * @see #setMaxVersions(int)
255    * @return this
256    */
257   public Scan setTimeStamp(long timestamp) {
258     try {
259       tr = new TimeRange(timestamp, timestamp+1);
260     } catch(IOException e) {
261       // Will never happen
262     }
263     return this;
264   }
265 
266   /**
267    * Set the start row of the scan.
268    * @param startRow row to start scan on (inclusive)
269    * Note: In order to make startRow exclusive add a trailing 0 byte
270    * @return this
271    */
272   public Scan setStartRow(byte [] startRow) {
273     this.startRow = startRow;
274     return this;
275   }
276 
277   /**
278    * Set the stop row.
279    * @param stopRow row to end at (exclusive)
280    * Note: In order to make stopRow inclusive add a trailing 0 byte
281    * @return this
282    */
283   public Scan setStopRow(byte [] stopRow) {
284     this.stopRow = stopRow;
285     return this;
286   }
287 
288   /**
289    * Get all available versions.
290    * @return this
291    */
292   public Scan setMaxVersions() {
293     this.maxVersions = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
294     return this;
295   }
296 
297   /**
298    * Get up to the specified number of versions of each column.
299    * @param maxVersions maximum versions for each column
300    * @return this
301    */
302   public Scan setMaxVersions(int maxVersions) {
303     this.maxVersions = maxVersions;
304     return this;
305   }
306 
307   /**
308    * Set the maximum number of values to return for each call to next()
309    * @param batch the maximum number of values
310    */
311   public void setBatch(int batch) {
312     if (this.hasFilter() && this.filter.hasFilterRow()) {
313       throw new IncompatibleFilterException(
314         "Cannot set batch on a scan using a filter" +
315         " that returns true for filter.hasFilterRow");
316     }
317     this.batch = batch;
318   }
319 
320   /**
321    * Set the number of rows for caching that will be passed to scanners.
322    * If not set, the default setting from {@link HTable#getScannerCaching()} will apply.
323    * Higher caching values will enable faster scanners but will use more memory.
324    * @param caching the number of rows for caching
325    */
326   public void setCaching(int caching) {
327     this.caching = caching;
328   }
329 
330   /**
331    * Apply the specified server-side filter when performing the Scan.
332    * @param filter filter to run on the server
333    * @return this
334    */
335   public Scan setFilter(Filter filter) {
336     this.filter = filter;
337     return this;
338   }
339 
340   /**
341    * Setting the familyMap
342    * @param familyMap map of family to qualifier
343    * @return this
344    */
345   public Scan setFamilyMap(Map<byte [], NavigableSet<byte []>> familyMap) {
346     this.familyMap = familyMap;
347     return this;
348   }
349 
350   /**
351    * Getting the familyMap
352    * @return familyMap
353    */
354   public Map<byte [], NavigableSet<byte []>> getFamilyMap() {
355     return this.familyMap;
356   }
357 
358   /**
359    * @return the number of families in familyMap
360    */
361   public int numFamilies() {
362     if(hasFamilies()) {
363       return this.familyMap.size();
364     }
365     return 0;
366   }
367 
368   /**
369    * @return true if familyMap is non empty, false otherwise
370    */
371   public boolean hasFamilies() {
372     return !this.familyMap.isEmpty();
373   }
374 
375   /**
376    * @return the keys of the familyMap
377    */
378   public byte[][] getFamilies() {
379     if(hasFamilies()) {
380       return this.familyMap.keySet().toArray(new byte[0][0]);
381     }
382     return null;
383   }

386    * @return the startrow
387    */
388   public byte [] getStartRow() {
389     return this.startRow;
390   }
391 
392   /**
393    * @return the stoprow
394    */
395   public byte [] getStopRow() {
396     return this.stopRow;
397   }
398 
399   /**
400    * @return the max number of versions to fetch
401    */
402   public int getMaxVersions() {
403     return this.maxVersions;
404   }
405 
406   /**
407    * @return maximum number of values to return for a single call to next()
408    */
409   public int getBatch() {
410     return this.batch;
411   }
412 
413   /**
414    * @return caching the number of rows fetched when calling next on a scanner
415    */
416   public int getCaching() {
417     return this.caching;
418   }

420   /**
421    * @return TimeRange
422    */
423   public TimeRange getTimeRange() {
424     return this.tr;
425   }

427   /**
428    * @return RowFilter
429    */
430   public Filter getFilter() {
431     return filter;
432   }

434   /**
435    * @return true is a filter has been specified, false if not
436    */
437   public boolean hasFilter() {
438     return filter != null;
439   }

441   /**
442    * Set whether blocks should be cached for this Scan.
443    * <p>
444    * This is true by default.  When true, default settings of the table and
445    * family are used (this will never override caching blocks if the block
446    * cache is disabled for that family or entirely).
447    *
448    * @param cacheBlocks if false, default settings are overridden and blocks
449    * will not be cached
450    */
451   public void setCacheBlocks(boolean cacheBlocks) {
452     this.cacheBlocks = cacheBlocks;
453   }
454 
455   /**
456    * Get whether blocks should be cached for this Scan.
457    * @return true if default caching should be used, false if blocks should not
458    * be cached
459    */
460   public boolean getCacheBlocks() {
461     return cacheBlocks;
462   }
463 
464   /**
465    * Set the value indicating whether loading CFs on demand should be allowed (cluster
466    * default is false). On-demand CF loading doesn't load column families until necessary, e.g.
467    * if you filter on one column, the other column family data will be loaded only for the rows
468    * that are included in result, not all rows like in normal case.
469    * With column-specific filters, like SingleColumnValueFilter w/filterIfMissing == true,
470    * this can deliver huge perf gains when there's a cf with lots of data; however, it can
471    * also lead to some inconsistent results, as follows:
472    * - if someone does a concurrent update to both column families in question you may get a row
473    *   that never existed, e.g. for { rowKey = 5, { cat_videos => 1 }, { video => "my cat" } }
474    *   someone puts rowKey 5 with { cat_videos => 0 }, { video => "my dog" }, concurrent scan
475    *   filtering on "cat_videos == 1" can get { rowKey = 5, { cat_videos => 1 },
476    *   { video => "my dog" } }.
477    * - if there's a concurrent split and you have more than 2 column families, some rows may be
478    *   missing some column families.
479    */
480   public void setLoadColumnFamiliesOnDemand(boolean value) {
481     setAttribute(ONDEMAND_ATTR, Bytes.toBytes(value));
482   }
483 
484   /**
485    * Get the logical value indicating whether on-demand CF loading should be allowed.
486    */
487   public boolean doLoadColumnFamiliesOnDemand() {
488     byte[] attr = getAttribute(ONDEMAND_ATTR);
489     return attr == null ? false : Bytes.toBoolean(attr);
490   }
491 
492   /**
493    * Compile the table and column family (i.e. schema) information
494    * into a String. Useful for parsing and aggregation by debugging,
495    * logging, and administration tools.
496    * @return Map
497    */
498   @Override
499   public Map<String, Object> getFingerprint() {
500     Map<String, Object> map = new HashMap<String, Object>();
501     List<String> families = new ArrayList<String>();
502     if(this.familyMap.size() == 0) {
503       map.put("families", "ALL");
504       return map;
505     } else {
506       map.put("families", families);
507     }
508     for (Map.Entry<byte [], NavigableSet<byte[]>> entry :
509         this.familyMap.entrySet()) {
510       families.add(Bytes.toStringBinary(entry.getKey()));
511     }
512     return map;
513   }
514 
515   /**
516    * Compile the details beyond the scope of getFingerprint (row, columns,
517    * timestamps, etc.) into a Map along with the fingerprinted information.
518    * Useful for debugging, logging, and administration tools.
519    * @param maxCols a limit on the number of columns output prior to truncation
520    * @return Map
521    */
522   @Override
523   public Map<String, Object> toMap(int maxCols) {
524     // start with the fingerpring map and build on top of it
525     Map<String, Object> map = getFingerprint();
526     // map from families to column list replaces fingerprint's list of families
527     Map<String, List<String>> familyColumns =
528       new HashMap<String, List<String>>();
529     map.put("families", familyColumns);
530     // add scalar information first
531     map.put("startRow", Bytes.toStringBinary(this.startRow));
532     map.put("stopRow", Bytes.toStringBinary(this.stopRow));
533     map.put("maxVersions", this.maxVersions);
534     map.put("batch", this.batch);
535     map.put("caching", this.caching);
536     map.put("cacheBlocks", this.cacheBlocks);
537     List<Long> timeRange = new ArrayList<Long>();
538     timeRange.add(this.tr.getMin());
539     timeRange.add(this.tr.getMax());
540     map.put("timeRange", timeRange);
541     int colCount = 0;
542     // iterate through affected families and list out up to maxCols columns
543     for (Map.Entry<byte [], NavigableSet<byte[]>> entry :
544       this.familyMap.entrySet()) {
545       List<String> columns = new ArrayList<String>();
546       familyColumns.put(Bytes.toStringBinary(entry.getKey()), columns);
547       if(entry.getValue() == null) {
548         colCount++;
549         --maxCols;
550         columns.add("ALL");
551       } else {
552         colCount += entry.getValue().size();
553         if (maxCols <= 0) {
554           continue;
555         } 
556         for (byte [] column : entry.getValue()) {
557           if (--maxCols <= 0) {
558             continue;
559           }
560           columns.add(Bytes.toStringBinary(column));
561         }
562       } 
563     }       
564     map.put("totalColumns", colCount);
565     if (this.filter != null) {
566       map.put("filter", this.filter.toString());
567     }
568     // add the id if set
569     if (getId() != null) {
570       map.put("id", getId());
571     }
572     return map;
573   }
574 
575   //Writable
576   public void readFields(final DataInput in)
577   throws IOException {
578     int version = in.readByte();
579     if (version > (int)SCAN_VERSION) {
580       throw new IOException("version not supported");
581     }
582     this.startRow = Bytes.readByteArray(in);
583     this.stopRow = Bytes.readByteArray(in);
584     this.maxVersions = in.readInt();
585     this.batch = in.readInt();
586     this.caching = in.readInt();
587     this.cacheBlocks = in.readBoolean();
588     if(in.readBoolean()) {
589       this.filter = Classes.createWritableForName(
590         Bytes.toString(Bytes.readByteArray(in)));
591       this.filter.readFields(in);
592     }
593     this.tr = new TimeRange();
594     tr.readFields(in);
595     int numFamilies = in.readInt();
596     this.familyMap =
597       new TreeMap<byte [], NavigableSet<byte []>>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
598     for(int i=0; i<numFamilies; i++) {
599       byte [] family = Bytes.readByteArray(in);
600       int numColumns = in.readInt();
601       TreeSet<byte []> set = new TreeSet<byte []>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
602       for(int j=0; j<numColumns; j++) {
603         byte [] qualifier = Bytes.readByteArray(in);
604         set.add(qualifier);
605       }
606       this.familyMap.put(family, set);
607     }
608 
609     if (version > 1) {
610       readAttributes(in);
611     }
612   }
613 
614   public void write(final DataOutput out)
615   throws IOException {
616     out.writeByte(SCAN_VERSION);
617     Bytes.writeByteArray(out, this.startRow);
618     Bytes.writeByteArray(out, this.stopRow);
619     out.writeInt(this.maxVersions);
620     out.writeInt(this.batch);
621     out.writeInt(this.caching);
622     out.writeBoolean(this.cacheBlocks);
623     if(this.filter == null) {
624       out.writeBoolean(false);
625     } else {
626       out.writeBoolean(true);
627       Bytes.writeByteArray(out, Bytes.toBytes(filter.getClass().getName()));
628       filter.write(out);
629     }
630     tr.write(out);
631     out.writeInt(familyMap.size());
632     for(Map.Entry<byte [], NavigableSet<byte []>> entry : familyMap.entrySet()) {
633       Bytes.writeByteArray(out, entry.getKey());
634       NavigableSet<byte []> columnSet = entry.getValue();
635       if(columnSet != null){
636         out.writeInt(columnSet.size());
637         for(byte [] qualifier : columnSet) {
638           Bytes.writeByteArray(out, qualifier);
639         }
640       } else {
641         out.writeInt(0);
642       }
643     }
644     writeAttributes(out);
645   }
646 
647   /**
648    * Enable/disable "raw" mode for this scan.
649    * If "raw" is enabled the scan will return all
650    * delete marker and deleted rows that have not
651    * been collected, yet.
652    * This is mostly useful for Scan on column families
653    * that have KEEP_DELETED_ROWS enabled.
654    * It is an error to specify any column when "raw" is set.
655    * @param raw True/False to enable/disable "raw" mode.
656    */
657   public void setRaw(boolean raw) {
658     setAttribute(RAW_ATTR, Bytes.toBytes(raw));
659   }
660 
661   /**
662    * @return True if this Scan is in "raw" mode.
663    */
664   public boolean isRaw() {
665     byte[] attr = getAttribute(RAW_ATTR);
666     return attr == null ? false : Bytes.toBoolean(attr);
667   }
668 
669   /*
670    * Set the isolation level for this scan. If the
671    * isolation level is set to READ_UNCOMMITTED, then
672    * this scan will return data from committed and
673    * uncommitted transactions. If the isolation level 
674    * is set to READ_COMMITTED, then this scan will return 
675    * data from committed transactions only. If a isolation
676    * level is not explicitly set on a Scan, then it 
677    * is assumed to be READ_COMMITTED.
678    * @param level IsolationLevel for this scan
679    */
680   public void setIsolationLevel(IsolationLevel level) {
681     setAttribute(ISOLATION_LEVEL, level.toBytes());
682   }
683   /*
684    * @return The isolation level of this scan.
685    * If no isolation level was set for this scan object, 
686    * then it returns READ_COMMITTED.
687    * @return The IsolationLevel for this scan
688    */
689   public IsolationLevel getIsolationLevel() {
690     byte[] attr = getAttribute(ISOLATION_LEVEL);
691     return attr == null ? IsolationLevel.READ_COMMITTED :
692                           IsolationLevel.fromBytes(attr);
693   }
694 }
This page was automatically generated by Maven
